snippet: Italy’s justice minister protested saying that the request for the extradition of the former C.I.A. officer, Robert Seldon Lady, based on an Interpol warrant, “has been disregarded without plausible explanations.”
abstract: Former Central Intelligence Agency officer Robert Seldon Lady, who was detained in Panama in connection with a criminal conviction in Italy for his role in 2003 abduction of Egyptian-born Muslim cleric Hassan Mustafa Osama Nasr, is released and flown to the United States.
lead_paragraph: Italy’s justice minister protested saying that the request for the extradition of the former C.I.A. officer, Robert Seldon Lady, based on an Interpol warrant, “has been disregarded without plausible explanations.”

headline.main: Panama: Former Spy Returns to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Panama: Former Spy Returns to U.S.
